text: Hi this might be a stupid question but i just don´t know the answer. I have an image in an email and i attached the "?noresize" to it. But for some reason it still scales the image up to 100% on mobile. Is there a way to prevent this?
Sounds unrelated to the noresize sounds like you have css in the email scaling it up for mobile you'll need to counteract that
hi Jon, thanks for the response, i figured it out!
Is there a good alternative to <http://litmus.com|litmus.com>?
There’s email on acid but honestly

litmus is worth every cent.

Include it in your client’s bill if have to in order to pay for it. that $100 often cuts out 3-5 hours of troubleshooting HTML emails making it litterally more cost effective to do pay for than to go without
thanks Jon!
Getting an error when I attempt to remove a module from a flexible container in the page editor. Anyone else seeing this?

We are using HubSpot forms for customers to submit an insurance claim, one snag we are encountering is that the member/customer needs a copy of the form after they submit it. Some sort of print screen on submit, or workflow email that sends them the form data would be sufficient. Is there a way to accomplish this?
let me know what you figure out.  I have a client that is wanting a pdf printout generated from data in a form.    looking at building something in vue presently
Is it possible to show  different currencies for a pricing table based on the users location? aka the user from Germany sees Euro pricing, the user from Swiss sees CHF (Swiss Franks)?
There was a contributor in the HubSpot community that had a similar issue and solved it using personalization tokens and workflows
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Email-Marketing-Tool/Send-copy-of-form-submission-to-user/m-p/202588/highlight/true#M1640>

You can do this with smart content:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/add-smart-content-to-your-website-pages-landing-pages-and-emails>
thanks, i just found the article right after posting...next time i have to pay more attention :wink:..
The down side is you can’t use it in custom modules, Though you can use it in custom global modules
good to know!
Hmm. Ok I saw that, also trying to find other soltions
solutions* thanks.

Definitely a functionality HubSpot needs to work towards including in the future. I think the only way around it would be to use the API and create your own forms so you'd have more control over the data
agreed

When create new property the Group field cannot be changed from the default which is "Contact information" and the Field type cannot be changed from the default of "Single-line text". How can i change them?? I am on HubSpot crm free plan. Are those fields locked to their defaults in this plan??

can anyone confirm this is still the correct markup the blog uses (we are going to do a custom coded blog template). I want to make sure there are no changes to this: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/blog-content-markup>

I think it looks pretty updated but you know, there are some chances that maybe is not complete, so you can just create a basic blog template and covert to a coded so you are 100% sure that is correct
Problem is when you do that, it only shows module includes on the html portion

oh, well you don't really need the blocks I think. Specially the blog content asyou can manually do that `if`. So I suggest to just copy the default content from each tab (from the drag&drop) to your coded
and actually, thats pretty much what you need...
but the main separation is the `{% if is_listing_view %}` correct?
yep
I mean i know it is, just looking for that extra verficiation
Awesome, thank you <@U7ADCU3BM>
actually seems pretty poor to me, you will probably want to improve it with `topic` and `blog_author` too, to expand the layouts for the different listings
yup, thats the plan at the current moment

We're working with a customer who needs to take the HubSpot blog RSS but without the HTML in the <description> tags. i.e. taking out all the references to features images, etc. I'm not convinced that it's possible. Does anyone have any ideas?
if you’re exporting couldn’t you export everything in full then find and replace all of the tags you don’t want?

I normally have done this with personalization tokens. I have also use JsPDF to generate a printable PDF on form submit. If you are not comfortable is jquery/javascript, i wouldnt recommend this route.  <https://github.com/MrRio/jsPDF>
slippery slope.  tried implementing that for a project, but too many issues.  nearly ripped my remaining hairs out
:octocat::octocat::octocat::octocat: :point_right: What are the best resources to use for learning GitHub?
If you go to the <#CCQSQ2C6L|crankshaft> git repo i have a ton listed there that are great
Thanks! Noting those done. One not listed in Crankshaft that I stumbled on is here: <https://lab.github.com/> Might be worth adding?
That one seems cool thanks for pointing it out I'll add links to it

Hi guys,
I just want to know if A/B testing is supported on dynamic pages? Any recommendations?
Thanks, Jon. Rather than an export, we're looking to plug the RSS feed into a live dashboard.

Also I want to know if SEO optimization is supported on dynamic pages. Thanks!
<#C22PDRW72|data-driven-content> <#C22PJ878V|random> <#C26E7JT8V|ideas>
